reviewText: This 30 minute NASA documentary combines images of mission control and spectators with the sound of the atronauts (Jim Lovell, Jack Swigert and Fred Haise) of the endangered Apollo 13 moon rocket as they announce their predicament and NASA engineers and astronaut Ken Mattingly gradually makes progress in bringing them home.  Includes scenes such as comedian Milton Berle asking a crowd to pray and President Nixon's closing statement: "Their safe return is a tribute to their own courage and also to the ingenuity and resourcefulness of those on the ground who helped transform potential tragedy into a heart stopping rescue."
